alert.note: Alert for Dearborn (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 5:40PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF DEARBORN COUNTY THROUGH 615 PM EDT... At 539 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 8 miles northwest of Bright, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Aurora, Bright, Hidden Valley, Guilford, Wilmington, Logan, Manchester, Sunman, St. Leon, West Harrison, Dover, Weisburg, Interstate 74 at US Route 52, New Trenton, Lawrenceville, New Alsace and Mount Sinai. This includes the following Interstates... I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 158 and 171. I-74 in Ohio near mile marker 0. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
